Hero.Title: Park of Colors
Hero.Description: Rediscovering the cycle of nature, among resilient flora and curious fauna!
Hero.Phrase: immerse yourself in the rhythms of nature
Hero.Button1: Get to know each other better

Park_History.Title: Park History
Park_History.Paragraph_1: The English Park, located in Castelgrande in Basilicata, about 1,000 m.a.s.l. covers an area of two hectares in the Coppolo locality.
Park_History.Paragraph_2: Designed by Professor Spicciarelli and dedicated to the famous botanist Guglielmo Gasparrini, the park was built in 2012 using European funds.
Park_History.Paragraph_3: Initially managed by the Gasparrini Association, it then came under the management of the Aphelion Association and, since 2020, has been administered by the Inti Aps Association.
Park_History.Paragraph_4: The park is surrounded by an ancient oak forest crossed by a small stream. Within it are numerous varieties of trees, shrubs, creepers and fruit trees that complement the native flora.

Inty History.Title: History of Inti
Inty History.Paragraph_1: The association was founded in 2020 with the aim of restoring life to the Park of Colors, which was in a state of neglect at the time, and promoting the preservation of Lucanian biodiversity.
Inty History.Paragraph_2: The name “Inti,” of Quechua origin, means “light bearers,” a concept that reflects the association's mission: to bring light and hope to the Lucanian Apennines.
Inty History.Paragraph_3: Since 2020, art gardeners Valentina Di Carlo and Lorenzo Staderini have been designing and “playing” with the flowering cycles of native plants and introduced species, ensuring consistent blooms and alternating colors.
Inty History.Paragraph_4: The association's main activity is breeding native butterflies and raising awareness of pollinator protection.
Inty History.Paragraph_5: Currently, the association is involved in the planning, maintenance and management of the park, also organizing guided tours and workshops.

GuidesList.name: Valentina Di Carlo
GuidesList.specialty: Documentary filmmaker, art gardener, educator, caterpillar and butterfly breeder – Stories and curiosities about the world of plants and butterflies
GuidesList.bio: Passionate about the natural world, able to guide visitors on a journey to discover the hidden treasures of flora and fauna. Her mission is to raise awareness and educate the public about the beauty and importance of the natural environment.

GuidesList.name: Lorenzo
GuidesList.specialty: Chef, art gardener, farmer, caterpillar and butterfly breeder – A perfect recipe to discover curiosities about plants and dishes
GuidesList.bio: Passionate about cooking and with deep respect for the land, he is a figure capable of telling and preparing dishes that testify to a deep connection with nature and the cycle of the seasons.
